content: Just played this clash. Half the players submitted solutions with < instead of <= and got 100% on the tests but only 50% on the validators. This ruins the clash. Please make the tests consistent with the validators, especially since the distinction between < and <= according to the problem statement is somewhat implicit: most non-native English speakers can't be expected to know whether " the team's combined power exceeds P" is true or not when the team's combined power is exactly P.

Nice clash, but the tests are not good currently.

Validator 2 and Validator 3 are the only cases that test for [[integer]] = [[P]]. This is the core edge case of the clash and it's not covered in tests, which means clashers who don't code it correctly can get 100% on tests and then only 50% on validators.

I suggest creating a new test/validator pair and perhaps swapping Validator 2 with Test 3.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very interesting proposition. well done !

Is Sensei guaranteed to select at least one ninja? If so, this should be explicitly stated in the problem. If not, a test case (both test and validator) for this scenario needs to be added.

Also, P=output case should be added as a test, not just as a validator.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle! Appropriate simple but fun Clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Its a nice quick and simple challenge; creative and would be able to ne solved within the time constraints

Input
* Please delete the space after "Line 1".

* Please format "Line 1" and "Line 2" in <<bold>>.

* Please delete "(each between 1 and 100)".

Output
* Please format "P" as a [[variable]].

Stub generator
* Line 2: Please change to:
loopline N power:int

Cases
* Each test and its corresponding validator should form a pair - they should be similar, but not the same. Please revise the validators accordingly.

Thanks.
